Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2010 02:33PM pinkribbongirl wrote: Thanks Lainey64...it's been 3 weeks today, and doesn't seem to be getting much better.  Seems like everyday is a different ache!!!  I can  see light peach fuzz all over my head now though so thats something to cheer about:)
Posts.Title: How long body aches last after Taxol pinkribbongirl pinkribbongirl

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2010 08:53AM pinkribbongirl wrote: Sweetlander, Do you take anything for the pain or just deal with it?  I was wondering if there's any natural remidies out there rather than pain medication.  I went to the mall with my daughter yesterday for awhile, and didn't think I could walk into the house afterwards my body hurt so bad.  That's terrible!!  I go to my oncologist this Thursday for my first check up and will see what she says to do.  Hopefully this gets better with time.  I am sooo thankful to be done with the chemo, I hate to be a whiner about the after aches and pains. pinkribbongirl
Posts.Title: How long body aches last after Taxol pinkribbongirl pinkribbongirl

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2010 07:39AM pinkribbongirl wrote: DiDit, I'm at about a month now, and the body aches are still here...also the hip, knee, and shoulder  pain is quite bad.  I tried doing some yoga last night to try and stretch things back out.  I have my month check up with my Onco Thursday, so we will see what she has to say about it.  I think I will ask about Glucosamine...seems to be alot of people talking about it!  I agree with you though, I didn't have this kind of pain and tightness before chemo.  I'll let you know what she has to say!! pinkribbongirl
Posts.Title: How long body aches last after Taxol pinkribbongirl pinkribbongirl

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2010 09:15AM pinkribbongirl wrote: She really just told me that yeah it's probably from the chemo...it takes awhile for the effects to go away.  Gave me another prescription for pain meds, she also gave me a script for something for hot flashes.  They did something called a CYP2D6 (?) blood test to see if I was able to take Tamoxifin...and yes lucky devil me, I am:)  Thursday, it will be 5 weeks since my last chemo, and I still have the all over body aches.  Not much seem to help it.  I haven't been able to sleep very well, so I'm sure this doesn't help much.  Does  anyone else have trouble with sleeping?  If so any natural remedies?  On a positive note, my hair is about a 1/2 to 3/4" long all over my head!!!  It feels like a baby's head.  Haha I'll probably have bald spots from rubbing it so much!!!  I'm just seeing signs of eyebrows, and lashes.  Still look like a chemo patient though. Hugs to everyone, and stay warm! pinkribbongirl
Posts.Title: How long body aches last after Taxol pinkribbongirl pinkribbongirl

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2010 05:09PM pinkribbongirl wrote: enjoylife...just thought I'd pass along that I'm using Nioxin #2 as well.  I bought it at a store called Ulta Beauty Supply.  It was a 3 pack that had the shampoo, conditioner, and scalp treatment all in one kit.  I think it was around $35 or $40.  I'm 5 weeks out, and have about 1/2 inch of fuzz all over my head!!!  I think it's starting to get darker, my normal hair was very dark brown, almost black.  My oncologist told me to expect about 1/2 inch per month growth.  Seems like this will take forever!!  Happy hairgrowing to you:) pinkribbongirl
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2010 06:02PM pinkribbongirl wrote: Hi MarieK...I was just wondering if you have to have some eyelashes for the fake ones to be attached to?  Also, with the strip ones, can you use them on the bottom lid?  I'm a little past 3 weeks Post Taxol, and my hair is light, colorless, peachfuzz all over my head, but my last 2 eyelashes, and 5 eyebrows have fallen out:(  Best Wishes to you, pinkribbongirl

Where did you get yours? pinkribbongirl
